title: Access Denied
text:
A social enterprise in Guelph has been leaving books filled with inspirational quotes and reminders about self worth around the downtown core.

And more books are expected to be hidden across southern Ontario this fall.

The books were hidden by The Community Company, which is a social business that empowers local makers to collaborate and create items and pay them a fair share of any profits.

Founder Justin Chan says the boxes are meant to send the message: "You are enough."

The boxes include the book with inspirational quotes and daily self worth reminders, a handmade bracelet that has a lava bead which can be used for essential oils, coupons to local businesses that offer self-care items or activities, three tea blends and a gratitude card.

The idea behind the boxes is to purchase one for yourself or as a gift — a little pick-me-up — while also supporting the people who helped make the box, Chan said.

"Another method of self-care is appreciating people in your life," Chan said.

'Super, super positive' response

Chan says in September, about 30 self-care books were distributed in downtown Guelph with a sticky note that said "free."

"The reception that we got from the community was super, super positive," he said.

Three people reached out directly to say thank you for the book, which Chan said in turn was a nice boost in confidence for the people who helped make the box.

"That was a really, really cool feeling for our creators and they were really, really excited to make that kind of an impact that we decided to keep doing it," he said.

Now, books are expected to be sent to Kitchener and Waterloo, Toronto, Windsor as well as Burnaby, B.C.
description: A social enterprise in Guelph has been leaving books filled with inspirational quotes and reminders about self worth around the downtown core. They plan to expand the project to other cities in southern Ontario this fall.
